definition: to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work

sentences.english: She learns to speak Latin by osmosis within three months.
sentences.chinese: 她廢寢忘食地在三個月內學會了拉丁語。

sentences.english: Building model trains is his consuming passion.
sentences.chinese: 製作模型火車是他廢寢忘食的愛好。

sentences.english: In the company, he is called workaholic He spends most of his time working, and often forgets to have meals or to go to bed.
sentences.chinese: 他把大部分時間都用於工作，爲工作他常常廢寢忘食。

sentences.english: She learns to speak Lation by osmosis within three months.
sentences.chinese: 她廢寢忘食三個月學會了拉丁語。

sentences.english: Fuller clock drilling, and finally out of a training extraordinary boy.
sentences.chinese: 恆景廢寢忘食苦練，終於練出了一身非凡的武藝。

definition: to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
(idiom) (of a good outcome) unanticipated/serendipitous/fortuitous
with single-hearted devotion (idiom)
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
lit. to clasp the Buddha's feet when danger arises (idiom); fig. to profess devotion only when in trouble/doing things at the last minute/making a hasty last-minute effort
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
to rack one's brains
murky darkness suddenly opens (idiom); a sudden flash of insight and all is clear
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
overnight until daybreak (idiom); all night long/day and night
spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
to force someone to do something
to comprehend (new things) by analogy
to be a tax on (one's mind)/to bother/to trouble/to be concerned
self-taught/to learn without a teacher (idiom)
